title: Infused honey has health benefits and tastes great
text:
Play Despite England's reputation for loving tea, the vast majority of us apparently have no idea how to make the perfect brew. Sky's Richard Suchet has been finding out how it is done. on.aol.com Honey is so good for us. Not only delicious, it is anti bacterial, soothes sore throats and flavors sweets, poultry, tea, biscuits and so much more. Given its great taste and healthful benefits, herb infused honey can do even more good.
Lemon infused honey is excellent to soothe sore throats and cold symptoms. public domain View all 8 photos public domain Infusing honey with herbs, spices or fruits allows the honey to take on the herbal healthy characteristics as well. For example, a cup of chamomile tea before bedtime can help to provide a restful, deep sleep. By adding a spoonful of lavender infused honey, the tea not only tastes better but also increases the chance of drifting off quickly and easily. No more tossing and turning!
Another example is lemon infused honey. This honey is powerful when dealing with a cold's symptoms. While it will not get rid of the cold, it definitely will help you deal with the aches, pains and sore throats associated with a cold. By adding some ginger, it will also help relieve an upset stomach.
Some ideas on what types of herbs, spices and fruits to use include grated citrus peels, split vanilla beans, spearmint or peppermint, grated peeled ginger, rosemary, lavender, cinnamon sticks, thyme and sage. Remember that it does not need to be a single flavor infusion, as combinations can be fantastic. Some combinations that work well together are lavender and vanilla, mint and citrus, and ginger and lemon.
Here are the basic directions, with tips afterwards.
Supplies
Glass jars with screw type tops or small half pint canning jars with rims and lids
Honey
Flavoring of choice
Fill your glass jars part way with your flavoring. The more you use, the stronger the flavor will be, and the less you use, a more mild flavor will be the result. Take the honey and pour it over the ingredients in the jars. When the jar is halfway full, give it a stir with a wooden spoon, then continue filling to the top. Once all of your jars have been filled, cover with the lid and allow the flavors to infuse for at least 5 days. The longer you wait, the more flavorful your honey will be. Tips
If desired, once done, the infused honey can be strained with cheesecloth to remove any bits of herbs or spices. This is not necessary, however, some people do prefer a clear appearance. It is easiest if the honey is slightly warm.
Ginger is great as a "warming" flavor to provide comfort when chilled or have aches and pains associated with a cold. It also helps digestion, flushes toxins from the body and soothes sore throats. Applied to a scrape, ginger infused honey can help with inflammation and reduce the risk of infection.
Shelf life is about 6 months, so making small batches are important.
If crystals form, place the jar of honey in a pan of warm water. This will cause the crystals to dissolve.
Infusing 5 - 10 whole cloves in honey provides relief from mouth or toothache pain. The eugenol in the clove is a powerful numbing agent.
